meanings.definition: A type of medieval leg armor.
meanings.sent1: The knight wore sturdy chausses to protect his legs in battle.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate design on the chausses displayed in the museum.
meanings.sent3: The chausses seemed to have a mind of their own, marching across the room.
meanings.sent4: His determination was his chausses, shielding him from the arrows of doubt.
meanings.sent5: The clang of metal echoed through the hall as the chausses clanked against the stone floor.

meanings.definition: A pair of leggings or stockings worn in medieval times.
meanings.sent1: The peasant's chausses were worn and patched from years of hard work.
meanings.sent2: She chose a comfortable pair of chausses to wear under her dress.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat got tangled in the chausses and stumbled around comically.
meanings.sent4: Her chausses were like a second skin, hugging her legs snugly.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the chausses brightened up the dreary castle courtyard.
